website_summaries.verdict: Uses a high-quality plastic construction to keep the weight and price down.
pros: Provides a single frequency at 5900Hz, so it's easy to use
Emits a very high-pitched sound that will grab the dog's attention while remaining at the edge of the audible range of humans
Plastic design is tough enough to survive drops on hard surfaces or dog bites
cons: The single frequency is tuned primarily for spaniels
not as effective for other breeds

customer_reviews.title: 7-month old Lab responds to this like nothing else
customer_reviews.text: 7-month old Lab responds to this like nothing else...we use it for more urgent recalls (like when she is running toward a stranger on the beach or slipped out the garage door) and ALWAYS reward the whistle call with real special dried chicken treats so it reinforces the whistle. She will even break from tangled play with other dogs when we whistle her. Otherwise she can be deaf to voice recalls when distracted. We put it on one of those coiled elastic wrist lanyards and always have it on a walk...because you never know when you might need it. We have 4 of them...one at each door and one by each retractible leash. Accessible convenience a must.
customer_reviews.author: Elizeon

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FOR CATS, TOO
customer_reviews.text: I easily trained my cat to come home when I activated her electronic collar beeper but she kept throwing the collars. It was too expensive to keep replacing those at $50 a throw so I tried this. The sound spooked her a little at first but once she associated the sound with me (and canned tuna) she comes for the whistle just as well as she did for the collar beeper. She stopped throwing her collars, too.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Midge

customer_reviews.title: My neighbors will be so happy that they won’t have to hear me screaming for ...
customer_reviews.text: It only took 3 days using cheese and praise then kibble and praise to train my chihuahuas to come when I use the whistle outside. Soon I will stop using food altogether and just give praise. But I’m totally blown away that it worked! My neighbors will be so happy that they won’t have to hear me screaming for my dogs! Food is a supreme motivator!! Patience pays off! But it happened much faster than I imagined!! I started in the House first to get them used to it and the treats. Then the rest is history!!! I couldn’t be more pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: LynnS

customer_reviews.title: Works if you know how to use it
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised. Just a helpful hint. You must give a command when using this or your pet will have no idea what to do, it’s a whistle people, it’s made to get attention not for your pet to read your mind. My advice is get training help if you need it and your dog will respond to positive talk and treats, if your one of the stupid morons that uses negative yelling or hitting your pet , well, you can’t fix stupid so maybe your the one that needs help 😘
customer_reviews.author: Djr1565Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This Dog whistle WORKS GREAT !
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful gadget. This is the 2nd one we got -= the first was black for me and now this orange one for the better half. We have a Labrador retriever and he hears it and comes - right now. A human can hear it up close as a minor sound that is inaudible a few feet away. The unit is plastic but well made - has that ring at the end so you can attach a string or lanyard (not included).
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Minimal training required and works great
customer_reviews.text: A very basic dog whistle but it gets the job done. I took about 3 minutes training my dog (a very intelligent Border Collie/Weimaraner mix) with the whistle, by blowing the whistle and immediately giving her a treat. Then I used it to call her in from the backyard--I would blow the whistle, and she would come running. I had to use it for an emergency a few days ago, when she pulled her head out of her collar when I was trying to get her to get into the back of my car, and she took off running. Thankfully, I had the whistle; I blew it, and she came running back immediately. Worth every cent in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: kso2011

customer_reviews.title: My dog comes home!
customer_reviews.text: So happy! I've been shouting and whistling to get my dog to come home from her adventures in the woods around my home. Im sure I was disturbing the peace. I doubted the whistle would get my dog to come home since comments seemed to indicate that the whistle was to stop barking. Much to my surprise, after blowing the whistle followed by a treat indoors a couple times, my dog came immediately when I blew the whistle outside. She was eager for her treat. Needless to say, I am very happy! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice whistle
customer_reviews.text: This whistle is great so far. It is certainly louder than I expected but that's ok. You can adjust the volume by changing how hard you blow into it. It's certainly not as loud as a lifeguard or coaches whistle. The sound isn't as shrill as those whistles are. I like it because it sounds the same to my dog no matter which member of the family is using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ewwww
customer_reviews.text: 90% of the price of this is for packaging and shipping (yes, there really isn't any "free" shipping). A weak sound, as others have commented, and hard to blow without covering up part of the hole on the underside, which makes it even weaker. I wish I had gone with the actual dog whistle, which is what I was replacing. Very nicely and safely packaged, though. Don't even think about using this as a safety whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Linda ScottTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: My first dog whistle so didn't know quite what to expect. It's not as loud as I imagined it would be but it only took about 3 lessons for my dog to understand that whistle = come. I haven't tried it over long distances but even when he's distracted at the park and in sight, he responds to it as well if not better than voice commands.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Do not attempt to silence neighbors dogs with this
customer_reviews.text: I blew once and the dogs stopped barking. The next day they just kept barking despite my blowing of the whistle. Problem eventually resolved when my dad yelled at the dogs so loud the neighbors got scared and put their dogs inside. (After years of incessant barking). May God have mercy on the souls of those who dogs are barking at. Probably good for training an animal. Definitely useless for silencing the neighbors dogs.
customer_reviews.author: jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Good Waterfowl Whistle
customer_reviews.text: Whistle works great. Makes training in town much more enjoyable for me, my lab, and my neighbors. Can blow many different tones on it. Sit, come, search, etc. It took me only about a day of practicing with it in the truck on the way to work before I had it dialed in and learned how to use it. Very happy with the purchase, dog responds well to it.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Great price for highly recommended dog whistle that proves effective
customer_reviews.text: When researching dog whistle and whistle training online, the ACME whistle kept coming up in articles. For under $10 the ACME whistle produces a clear audible tone so you consistently reproduce the same command (sound) each time. With plenty of treats and following training steps online, recall (come) whistle tweets started getting good results between one & two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall SM

customer_reviews.title: Nice small thin whisle
customer_reviews.text: This whistle is slim and fits nicely in my treat pouch side pocket without taking up too much room. As we live near playing fields I wanted a whistle with a different tone to the ones the coaches use. My dog responds very well to this whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Works fabulously
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkable device. Trained my dog in one walk to come to the whistle. We walk in the woods off leash and she loves to chase rabbits and can get out of sight. Instead of me bellowing her name a few whistle blows brings her right back to me. It has worked at least 200 yards away when she has been deep in bush and out of sight. It does make a soft whistle sound so you know It is working. I keep it in a lanyard around my neck. Get this one
customer_reviews.author: Grant Armendariz

customer_reviews.title: Both human and dog likes this!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Didn't take long to train our dog to come to the whistle. Not overly loud, so doesn't annoy anyone!
customer_reviews.author: B.A/M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Good whistle--maybe a few bucks over priced
customer_reviews.text: Great little whistle. Many people seem to be irritated by the high pitched sound, but that is what it is designed to do. I train hunting dogs on an amateur level, and this is a great whistle to start puppies on, and to use for grown dogs in the house. Only issue was when I ordered my second one of these it did not work at all, but Amazon gave me a full refund. As for price/value, I think it is a bit over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Lamarsh

customer_reviews.title: Acme dog whistle
customer_reviews.text: This does not put out enough sound for a dog whistle! If you want a strong dog whistle that your dog can hear, but the ACME DOG WHISTLE 211.5. Anything lower than 211.5 is useless for training.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Not a dog whistle
customer_reviews.text: This is not a dog whistle. It's just a cheap pealess whistle. Getting so tired of being duped by these online sellers!
customer_reviews.author: Dopy Doorite

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for Recall Training
customer_reviews.text: I've associated this whistle to dinner and tasty treats and never punish him when I use it and he comes. You can affect the volume with how hard you blow, and it is loud and clear but not obnoxious sounding to annoy neighbors or those in my house.
customer_reviews.author: NDP

customer_reviews.title: I like that it makes the signal for her to come ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my golden retriever. I like that it makes the signal for her to come one tone only. It snaps her out of whatever she is doing and she comes running. My husband and I train her by playing hide and seek, where we hide and then call for her with the whistle. It makes it a really fun game for her and easy training practice for us.
customer_reviews.author: Christian45

customer_reviews.title: Good whistle, decent value.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say really, it is a pretty simple product that performs its intended function well. I'm not an expert on English dog whistles, but this seems like a pretty good one as it's well constructed and has a fairly impressive sound. It's a bit pricey for something made entirely of plastic, but I'm getting a kick out of training my dog with it so I suppose it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Mazz

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This whistle works great! Our 7 month old Springer Spaniel now comes every time. Before maybe she'd come when called and maybe she wouldn't. I was afraid of losing her on our desert walks. Since the whistle we have had no problems. Started out giving her a treat when she recalled but after a few times she was ok with a "good girl". We highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rhapsody

customer_reviews.title: Good Whistle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to call my Black Lab in when she's out in the woods. After a few days of combining the whistle with my usual yelling she associated the whistle with the "come" command. The whistle is audible to humans if they're fairly close, but my dog can hear it when she's deep in the woods. Now I can call her in late at night and my neighbors don't have to hear me yelling her name. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: GoodSeal

customer_reviews.title: My dog responds quick.
customer_reviews.text: I love this whistle. The sound carries and my dog responds to it in the field. When I don't have to yell and the birds don't get wise its a good thing. Also, I think he responds quicker to the whistle because he hears my voice all the time when I talk to the kids or friends, but he knows the whistle is a command just for him. Its not magic, you must train your dog with it for this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Sportsman Shoppaholic(man)/Beauty Product Junkie(wife)

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as it is designed to. All the bad reviews are people not understanding what type of whistle this is supposed to be. It is not mentioned to be a silent whistle! It is a single pitch whistle (always the same tone).
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Kerr III

customer_reviews.title: Effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: Its okay. Works sometimes. Our springer was trained to come to a whistle while hunting. This whistle makes an attempt but not 100%. Also I had to buy a lanyard to use it . Next time I would purchase one with a lanyard, I use this for barking too; that part works about 80%. I guess it depends on your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Effective dog whistle.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I trained my dog by blowing the whistle right before meals or treats. Now she comes in no matter where she is, or whether she's in deep slumber. Great value for the bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amerigo McMansion

customer_reviews.title: Lab loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab and she responded wonderfully! I tried a whistle with a pea and it is very loud. However my labs performance at quick training reflects the effectiveness of the 210.5. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W

customer_reviews.title: Super treats, i use beef jerkey which they only ...
customer_reviews.text: I taught my lab and Jack Russell to come. Super treats, i use beef jerkey which they only get when they are training. Two short blasts. As soon as they arrive they get treat. First house only, then garden, then dog park. Google dog training! Perfect whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Beealright

customer_reviews.title: These are inexpensive and work terrific. I don't recommend the adjustable metal one I ...
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive and work terrific. I don't recommend the adjustable metal one I won't name bought on the cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle for dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have a large property with four rambunctious dogs that love to bark at everything couple toots from whistle they come to my command I like about this whistle is they respond very fast cuts down on the barking very good affected whistle don't get the adjustable their junk just whistle is just perfect
customer_reviews.author: debra mauldin

customer_reviews.title: It's not loud, but it IS effective.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend who uses a whistle to call her dog. She always forgets the whistle, so i gave to her as an extra. BUT, once it was used, the other one went on the shelf. We were amazed that this whistle was not as loud, but the dog responded 100% better than to the regular kids whistle. I totally recommend to people who has trained dogs with a whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Pat O'Maley

customer_reviews.title: It got my dogs attention the first time I blew ...
customer_reviews.text: It got my dogs attention the first time I blew it, then they could care less. I'm sure it's not the whistles fault, since I have not trained them to respond to it. I thought the pitch would be higher
customer_reviews.author: Pete Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Whistle enhances Verbal Commands
customer_reviews.text: Our dog doesn’t come when she’s called, but she seems to listen better to this whistle, then to calling her alone. I’m a little disappointed with the quality of the plastic. The advertised pitch of 210.5 appears to be accurate.
customer_reviews.author: SGT MAYHEM

customer_reviews.title: My dog seems to respond much better to click training ar this point in his life
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to respond much better to click training ar this point in his life, however, when we have tried to do training sessions to integrate the whistle, I get a whole neighborhood of barking dogs. I'd say it gets their attention.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Works for Frankenstein the BC
customer_reviews.text: Bought this whistle so as not to disturb my neighbors when calling in Frankenstein my 1.5 year old male border collie. At first he knew not what to do but after rewarding him by throwing a ball a few times he quickly grasped the idea. And now he calls me. Darn border collies, last time I get a dog that is smarter than me. The whistle is well made and hangs comfortably on a key chain.
customer_reviews.author: L. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for training our puppy!! Bought several different ones so that I could have them all over in case I go out and forget one or lose one. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mindy BB

customer_reviews.title: and she turned right around and ran back home for her favorite treat!
customer_reviews.text: It works. We trained our dog in the house to come when the whistle is blown. She shot out the door the other day (escaped) and was running down the street.... we grabbed the whistle , gave it one long blast , and she turned right around and ran back home for her favorite treat!!
customer_reviews.author: pdm

customer_reviews.title: worked right from the package - well at least it ...
customer_reviews.text: worked right from the package - well at least it got her attention. I was having trouble yelling loud enough for her to hear me from a long distance. This does the trick. Now comes the training to come - AFTER she hears it.....
customer_reviews.author: dkcharms

customer_reviews.title: just air coming out which is fine if the whistle can be heard by dogs
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't really work. I would have sent it back except that I had completely torn up the packaging trying to open it. It makes no noise when blown, just air coming out which is fine if the whistle can be heard by dogs. Unfortunately, none of my 3 dogs pay any attention to this whistle at all. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Good Whistle
customer_reviews.text: Very light plastic, but it makes a sound you can hear so you know it's working. My Shih Tzu responds to it even though he's stubborn as a mule!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D.

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm. so far works on all 3 of my dogs. Its plastic though so be aware it can break if use roughly. or your dog decides to chew on it. lol
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Dog whistle
customer_reviews.text: I always thought dog whistles were so high pitched that only dogs could hear them. This whistle does whistle and my dig does not pay any attention to it at all. I am not satisfied with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! The tone of this whistle stops my dogs immediately so I can redirect their behavior. So happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy444

customer_reviews.title: A Great Dog whistle
customer_reviews.text: This is the first one we purchased and everything I said about the orange one applies to this one. Our Labrador comes to either whistle which tells me that the manufacturer is keeping quality up. I cannot say enough good things about this whistle. For what it's worth, I originally bought a much more expensive (different brand) whistle at a major pet store - and the dog ignores it.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Loud!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and loud, easy to use without hands, and fairly easy to change tone in case you have trained your dog to react to changing tone.
customer_reviews.author: B. Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if worth it
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t really work, dogs don’t seem too bothered by it
customer_reviews.author: Santana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teaching whistle recall.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for teaching a solid whistle recall. I love a whistle recall especially on a windy day, as a whistle can carry longer than a voice.
customer_reviews.author: Karwyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dog training whistle.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this whistle after reading the book "Total Recall- Perfect Response Training for Puppies and Adult Dogs". The author recommends a whistle over a command because it can be heard further away and it doesn't convey any emotion (such as if you are frustrated with your dog). I've had good success teaching my dog recall with this whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Dee in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Its working
customer_reviews.text: Just started to use. I am working with my dog and it seems to get her attention.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Nice whistle, good sound, doesn't come unscrewed!!
customer_reviews.text: Performs as desired. Doesn't have the problem of unscrewing like the metal ones. You can hear it. I liked it so much I ordered another. My dog was **trained** to recall using the metal whistles (that use a screw adjust) and she recalled without a hitch the first time I used this one. I'll be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best dog whistle!!
customer_reviews.text: These dog whistles are the best. After trying these whistles out I'll never go back to buying the two-piece metal type. Don't waste your money on buying the metal whistles that screw together. One day you'll discover that half the whistle is missing because it came unscrewed and dropped to the ground - lost forever. Not so with these whistles; they're solid one-piece hard plastic will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: makes a discernible sound, was hoping for a silent dog whistle. Dog does respond, but it's not quite what I was looking for. Would probably not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Endless Summer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely gets their attention
customer_reviews.text: Dogs are responding. I have to blow hard but it does get their attention and they will be trained very quickly to stop barking at every thing that goes on around them
customer_reviews.author: Julie V.

customer_reviews.title: Dog whistle.
customer_reviews.text: It works! My little 6 months dog would ignore my calling until I got the ACME whistle.
customer_reviews.author: PAW

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this whistle in hopes of getting my old half deaf dog to come when called. He can hear it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for beast and man!
customer_reviews.text: Great whistle! My dog can easily hear it even over the wind. I can hear it too. But it isn't obnoxious like a coach's whistle. The people I hike with easily tolerate it too. It may look like cheap plastic but it really does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Works great, with proper training.
customer_reviews.text: It's loud ~ I'll grant you that ~ but our dogs have a large area to roam in. I started by blowing the whistle, and when they came to investigate, gave them each a treat. Or, every time I was about to give them a treat, (just because I love them and spoil them rotten), blowing the whistle first. Now, every time I blow it, they both come running, and praise and loving is enough for them, they don't need a treat every time they answer the whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Raindrop

customer_reviews.title: No yelling!
customer_reviews.text: We are training the dog to come to three blasts of the whistle. It work well. You don't have to yell. She also comes to a hand signal. Two fingers out with back of hand towards dog.
customer_reviews.author: S. Folkerts

customer_reviews.title: It gets my dog's attention!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other whistles and they seemed easy for my Shorkie to ignore. He perks up when he hears this one, even when I blow it softly . I haven't tested it long distance yet but will be working on training with him with it and a long lead to come off leash.
customer_reviews.author: Floridagal

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Does the job. Not as loud as I want it to be for training purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Myshenyenne Vang

customer_reviews.title: I like it right well
customer_reviews.text: I can hardly whistle anymore and needed to call the dawg back from her run. She hears this whistle and stops and sees me wave her back. Works well for me and the dawg. I like it right well, the dawg doesn't really care.
customer_reviews.author: George M. Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Our pup took to this unit after teaching him twice with treats. Its has a very nice high pitched whistle sound that can be heard for long distances just what we needed for our rambling dog.
customer_reviews.author: Heliflyer

customer_reviews.title: Works immediately
customer_reviews.text: My dog's recall is pretty consistent but, sometimes if there is a lot of commotion he will hesitate before coming to me. After following the instructions that came with the whistle, his recall was immediate; in any situation. I still rely on a verbal cue in most situations but, I always have the whistle when he is away from home and off leash, just in case. I would recommend this product to anyone who is not fully confident in their dog's recall.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: It makes a whistling noise like it says it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It makes a whistling noise like it says it's supposed to. The dogs I've used it with couldn't care less though! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Graham

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah. This is very well done.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what all hunters want at a good price. English Springer Spaniel competitions are just right for this whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Whistle!
customer_reviews.text: Great whistle! Dog responds to all commands given to him with this whistle. I’ve tried other brand dog whistles and this one is truly the best all around.Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Darby

customer_reviews.title: Really gets the dogs attention.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a silent whistle, but not obnoxiously loud. My dogs have selective hearing. If they are onto something interesting in the yard, they ignore me when I call them, but if I blow the whistle first, it gets their attention. It has made a big difference in getting them better trained.
customer_reviews.author: Donna W.

customer_reviews.title: ACME DOG WHISTLE
customer_reviews.text: THIS DOG WHISTLE GIVES JUST ENOUGH OF A LOUD SOUND TO LET YOU KNOW YOU'RE BLOWING IT RIGHT...AND THE DOGS DO STOP BARKING WHEN YOU BLOW IT WITH A QUIZZICAL "WHAT THE HECK WAS THAT" LOOK ON THEIR FACES...
customer_reviews.author: BACKBREAKER3858

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Recommend by my hunting dog trainer. Great value, easy to use and unlike a traditional dog whistle this one won't scare the birds away. It soulds natural, in the field hunting.
customer_reviews.author: SeaRayBoats

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but works well. Unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny but great whistle. Nice and unobtrusive to wear on a lanyard. Now if we can just "train the trainer", we'll be good to go! (And so will my dog.)
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I returned this whistle. It has absolutely no affect on my dog, nor the three dogs that live next door to me. I have no idea why this item has as many good reviews as it does. Total ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Katt

customer_reviews.title: Best whistle for close working dogs
customer_reviews.text: Best whistle for a springer spaniel. He responds so well to this whistle. Also it is not too loud and also doesn't have the vibration in the sound which I like a lot. Great training aide.
customer_reviews.author: Kody

customer_reviews.title: Dog Recall Whistle
customer_reviews.text: These work really well for my dogs. They've learned to return to me after a series of 5 quick pips, and then they get a treat. I have this same whistle in all of my normal dog-walking jackets and use it regularly. It's nice to be able to recall the dogs without shouting at the top of my lungs... :)
customer_reviews.author: Smashed

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this whistle I had 2 adjustable "silent" whistles. Each of them came apart on their first use and I returned home with 1⁄2 of a whistle! So I decided to go with this one-piece whistle and I'm glad I did! Works great, my dog responds, and I can use the whistle over & over without it coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: HCB

customer_reviews.title: loud to human ears and doesn't bother dog
customer_reviews.text: The whistle definitely annoys me/gets my attention more so than my dog's, a 70 lb pit bull. I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty lame, more like a toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a caller for my puppy. It is pretty lame, more like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this whistle.
customer_reviews.text: I have used one like this since my dog was a pup and he is used to the sound. It is not as loud as others and when I walk my dog at 5:30 AM and I need a whistle but not too loud, this one is perfect . This was the only place that I could find it.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: It took a few indoor treats over 2 days to train my hard-of-hearing dog to come when she hears the whistle. Works like a charm now so I don’t have to search for my little white dog in the snow. She comes running!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Murley

customer_reviews.title: I would have liked a different color
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked a different color, but the green ones were cheaper. Anyway, they work great and will come in handy next time my doodle decides to not "come" when called ;)
customer_reviews.author: Melinda L.

customer_reviews.title: Correct frequency for my Chesepeake
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My Chesepeake responds very well. Just one toot and he looks to me for a command.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Bentdahl

customer_reviews.title: I'm not really for sure if this is better than any other dog whistle you might find
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really for sure if this is better than any other dog whistle you might find. So far our dog doesn't seem to respond to it very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nieandermeiers

customer_reviews.title: Good whistle
customer_reviews.text: Good whistle, the item is exactly the same which appears in the supplier's description, unfurtunately the whistle didn't bring my dog's attention.
customer_reviews.author: Hogar Digital

customer_reviews.title: excelent!
customer_reviews.text: Price is good, able to purchase several (one for each family member, & a spare), Can be heard by dog at great distance (I never could do the "fingers in yer mouth whistle), beyond voice reach. I recommend using this for training, very effective tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: It works great we had excellent results with this product, a four-year-old can can recall the big dog with the whistle whereas before his voice was too small for the dog to pay attention to him.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, now just to get the dogs to work was well
customer_reviews.author: Louisa

customer_reviews.title: I thought I wouldn't like this when I found it is plastic
customer_reviews.text: I thought I wouldn't like this when I found it is plastic, but I prefer it to the metal whistle which is two parts and has to be adjusted. My dog responds quickly to this.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: It's working! Total Meatball recall.... my Newf can hear it in the next pasture and comes gallumphing to me and sits!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Price

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: my easily distracted dog has been hard to train but for some reason she perks up and responds to this whistle better than any other method I've tried. Thrilled with the results from such a simple but effective training tool.
customer_reviews.author: lilibet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works with my dog.. does not pierce my ears as “triller” whistle does.
customer_reviews.author: Sammikens

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for my dog. It's just sitting in the drawer
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Acme Dog Whistle
customer_reviews.text: Well made sonec dog whistle.......highly recommend. Takes a while to train your dog to listen/respond to your commands. Consistency and positive reinforement is the trick. After proper training, your dog will recognize the command and respond accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great training whistle
customer_reviews.text: Great training whistle. I have used it for several months while training my springer spaniel. Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Brojakowski

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My dog comes running to me every time I use it
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle
customer_reviews.text: Got this whistle to train my puppies to come to me outside rather than yell. Also, my own whistle is pretty lame. It's not too shrill, but the dogs hear it. Love the color. The only reason i gave it four stars is that it three weeks to get it. Guess it came from China.
customer_reviews.author: Rural Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My pointer seems very interested in this whistle. Really gets her attention. Light. Fits in pocket easily.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: A simple whistle sound that's perfect for dog response
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, not excessively loud, dog responds well, easy to put in mouth and use
customer_reviews.author: badger R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the best whistle for me. It is sturdy and clips in my keyring. Easy!
customer_reviews.author: Sara D.

customer_reviews.title: I love that I can have 6-8 people giving commands with ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my clients to use in a whistle recall class for dogs. I love that I can have 6-8 people giving commands with it in class and they are quiet enough for it to not sound like constant whistles!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

product_meta.title: Acme 210 Orange - Whistle
product_meta.description: Color:Orange| Size:210 pitchDesigned and made in the UK, High tone dog whistle, fitted with solid, waterproof pearl, to give a Trill for those who want a distinctive and different sound, with a frequency that fluctuates by 750 Hertz, easy blowing.. High tone dog whistle
feature_bullets: Designed and made in the UK
Fitted with solid, waterproof pearl, to give a trill for those who want a distinctive and different sound
With a frequency that fluctuates by 750 hertz
